articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK marked abroad 
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Functions were held in different countries in the run-up to the 54th birthday of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 Round-table conversations, seminars, photo exhibitions and film shows took place in Uganda, Ethiopia, Equatorial Guinea and Guinea between August 16 and 24.
 On display at the photo exhibition halls were photos showing feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in building the country and by Kim Jong Il in pursuing the army-based policy.    
 Screened at the film shows were "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Gives On-Site Guidance to Various Domains", "New Korea" and other films.

articles.title: Meeting of pro-reunification patriots
articles.content:
Angolan President calls for Korea's reunification 
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- We hope that Korea will be reunified under the policy of Kim Jong Il, Angolan President Jose Eduardo Dos Santos said on august 30 when meeting the DPRK delegation led by vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Yang Hyong Sop.
 The president expressed heartfelt thanks to Kim Jong Il for rendering disinterested aid of various forms to the struggle for independence and peace of Angola.    
 We are pleased to see the signal achievements Kim Jong Il has made in the efforts to reunify Korea and build a powerful nation by pursuing the army-centered policy, he said.

Greetings to Emir of Qatar
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday sent a message of greetings to Hamad Bin Khalifa al-Thani, Amir of the state of Qatar, on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of its independence.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms, the message wished the people of Qatar great success in their efforts for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.content:
Foreign delegations and delegates here
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of different countries arrived here today to participate in the 8th Pyongyang Film Festival of non-aligned and other developing countries. Among the arrivals were those from Laos, Russia, Malaysia, Belgium, Sweden, Australia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Hong Kong of China, Poland, Germany and Japan and a delegation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
 Noguchi Noboru, delegate from the UNESCO, and Yuri Kolosov, vice-chairman of the Russian Filmmakers Union, arrived here as honorary guests of the festival.    
 They were greeted at the airport by Jo Chan Gu, vice-minister of culture who is vice-chairman of the organizing committee of the festival, and other officials concerned.
